body:
Howdy,

So I'm thinking about buying cs:go but I have a pretty shit computer and want to make sure I will be able to run it with more than 20 fps. Does anyone know how intensive it is or if there are ways to improve performance on it like lowering graphics quality and stuff?

Thanks :^)
body_tagged:
Howdy,

So I'm thinking about buying cs:go but I have a pretty shit computer and want to make sure I will be able to run it with more than 20 fps. Does anyone know how intensive it is or if there are ways to improve performance on it like lowering graphics quality and stuff?

Thanks :^)
title: Quick Question

replies.body: Csgo on the lowest settings can be run on pretty much any computer, but knowing your specs could help us make a more educated guess.
replies.body_tagged: Csgo on the lowest settings can be run on pretty much any computer, but knowing your specs could help us make a more educated guess.

replies.body:
Yeah sorry I've honestly never payed attention to my specs because my PC is so God awful but I bought the game anyways so if anyone wants to play you can add my steam: smitdalt 
:^)
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
CS:GO was designed off the half life engine.

Basically a windows XP Computer can run it, as half life is over 15 years old.
replies.body_tagged:
CS:GO was designed off the half life engine.

Basically a windows XP Computer can run it, as half life is over 15 years old.

replies.body: Just don't play maps like cobblestone, CS:GO does not need much performance.
replies.body_tagged: Just don't play maps like cobblestone, CS:GO does not need much performance.
